issue.title: trendpick.shopping.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://trendpick.shopping.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftrendpick.shopping.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello there!
> 
> When using dns.adguard.com as Private DNS on Android, the domain trendpick.shopping.naver.com (TrendPick) is inaccessible from multiple browsers including Samsung Internet and Chrome. This domain is part of Naver Shopping, a major South Korean shopping platform (shopping.naver.com).
> 
> This is particularly concerning because TrendPick links appear on the main page of shopping.naver.com for logged-in users. Even though the links are marked as "AD" (See the second screenshot in AdGuard Disabled), many users often don't notice this and might end up thinking their error page encounter is due to a network or browser issue, rather than AdGuard DNS.
> 
> Could you take a look into this and consider allowlisting trendpick.shopping.naver.com if possible? Thank you so much!
Username: `@osori`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/lgtfool2itwogc4kgk884wsg48k44k8h8cypxoo4s8.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/acvv9aiwk68kck8so48s8oswk0k48wg4cbh7vcl0mi.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/4jeacxr39oo40wcsccgwck800ksckkw56jp8q66dto.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | Android 14, Samsung One UI 6.1.1
Browser: | Samsung Browser

issue.title: ohou.se
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Content Blocker

### AdGuard version

2.7.3

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://ohou.se/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. When using AdGuard Content Blocker on Samsung Internet, blank screen is encountered on ohou.se. Clicking the button on Screenshot 1 will redirect to a page that will supposedly prompt to open/download app in Google Play Store. With tracking protection filter open, however, it results in a blank screen (Screenshot 2).

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

**![website](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f37d6e59-59e1-4fe4-af66-801a342f6d49)**

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>

![blankscreen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22f01e70-3406-410b-930f-1642f1bf567b)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
